sentences.en: He first promised two weeks ago to clear Britain's congested roads.
sentences.cn: 他在两周前首次承诺解决英国道路拥堵的问题。

sentences.en: He knew how the traffic congested at the junction of Seventh Avenue and Forty - second Street.
sentences.cn: 他知道在第7街和第42街交叉处交通是多么拥挤.

sentences.en: His lungs seem to be congested.
sentences.cn: 他的两肺似乎有充血现象.

sentences.en: London’s roads are heavily congested (= very congested ) .
Many of Europe's airports are heavily congested.
sentences.cn: 欧洲许多机场都十分拥挤。

sentences.en: The arteries in his neck had become fatally congested.
sentences.cn: 他颈动脉栓塞，危在旦夕。

sentences.en: The central nervous system is congested.
sentences.cn: 中枢神经系统已经充血.

sentences.en: The city streets were congested with vehicles.
The highway was congested with cars.
The roads to Bordeaux were heavily congested.
sentences.cn: 通往波尔多的道路非常拥挤.

sentences.en: The street was congested with traffic.
sentences.cn: 街道因往来车辆而阻塞.

sentences.en: Traffic was already very congested by six thirty this morning, particularly on the M1 northbound.
sentences.cn: 今早6点30分时道路已经拥塞严重，尤其是M1号高速公路北行方向。

sentences.en: Wangfujing Street is always very congested.
sentences.cn: 王府井大街总是非常拥挤.

words.tran_cn: 挤满；超负荷（congest的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 拥挤(congest的过去式和过去分词)，堵塞
